page.title: 01ILKESTON GAZETTEER
page.content: Our area is part of the town of{ {ILKESTON}which is the third largest town in Derbyshire. It stands on high ground above the{Erewash Valley}on the eastern border of Derbyshire. It is 9 miles north east of Derby and 7 miles north west of Nottingham. Ilkeston was known as{Tilchestune}in the original {Domesday Survey.} Iron and concrete products, light engineering, hosiery, lingerie, lace and fabrics form the{basic industries; but there are also plastics, bedding, knitwear, packaging, electrical goods, electronics, food distribution and a variety of small industries. {Coal {mining,}once a major industry, has gone from the town itself and more than one site has been turned into a recreation ground or playing field. {Cotmanhay,}once a separate village, is now part of the town of Ilkeston.
